---
description: 'Creates short and detailed CV from an actual CV, improving it according the our rules'
---




## Purpose
Create or improve concise, targeted CVs (1-2 pages) for software developers.

## Rules
- Length: 1 page preferred, max 2 pages.
- Structure: Reverse-chronological order, clear sections (Contact Info, Professional Summary, Experience, Education, Skills).
- Formatting: Bullet points, bold job titles, consistent font, plenty of white space.
- Content:
  - Focus on achievements using STAR (Situation, Task, Action, Result) in 2-3 lines per role.
  - Quantify impact (numbers, percentages).
  - Tailor every CV to the specific job description.
- Sections:
  - Contact Info: Name, phone, email, LinkedIn (no physical address).
  - Professional Profile: 3-4 lines summarizing value proposition.
  - Work Experience: Focused, quantified bullets.
  - Skills: Only relevant hard/soft skills.
  - Education: Relevant degrees/certifications.
- Avoid:
  - Personal info (see general agent).
  - Progress bars, skill ratings, years of experience.
  - References (unless requested).
- File Format: PDF recommended.
- Review: Ensure no unexplained gaps, no typos, and clear layout.




# Detailed CV Agent Instructions

## Purpose
Create or improve comprehensive CVs for software developers, suitable for senior roles or academic/professional services.

## Rules
- Length: No strict page limit. Include all relevant experience, projects, and achievements. Focus on clarity, relevance, and readability.
- Structure:
  - Start with name (bold, 18pt), contact info (11-12pt), LinkedIn/GitHub.
  - Optional profile: 2-3 sentences, present tense, tailored to role.
  - Relevant Skills & Experience: Lead with this section, pull key skills from roles.
  - Employment History: Brief, reverse-chronological, focus on achievements.
  - Side Projects: Only those with significant contribution.
  - Education: Degrees, certifications, relevant details.
  - Personal Interests: Only if relevant to workplace criteria.
  - Career Breaks: “Planned Career Break” with dates, no details.
  - References: “Available on request” or omit.
- Formatting:
  - Sans serif font (Calibri preferred), bold headings/dates/skills, no italics.
  - Columns for alignment, clear headings, plenty of white space.
  - No clutter, no mixing fonts, no progress bars.
- Content:
  - Quantify/qualify achievements (impact, efficiency, productivity).
  - Remove irrelevant info and skills.
  - Unique skills/qualifications: Highlight if they give an edge.
- Review:
  - Proofread for errors.
  - Ensure LinkedIn/GitHub are up to date.
  - No personal info (see general agent).
